alert.note: Alert for Oglethorpe; Wilkes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Wilkes and central Oglethorpe Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Vesta to near Barnett Shoals, and moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lexington, Crawford, Tignall, Maxeys, Rayle, Stephens, Jacksons Crossroads, Mallorysville, Norman and Hutchings. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
